Item 5.07 - Submission of Matters to a V.content: On June 20, 2024, DoorDash, Inc. (the “Company”) held its 2024 annual meeting of stockholders (the “Annual Meeting”). The stockholders of the Company voted on the following three proposals at the Annual Meeting, each of which is more fully described in the Company’s definitive proxy statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on April 26, 2024.

subsections.Proposal 1: Election of Directors:
The voting results for the election of three Class I directors were as follows:

Nominee Elinor Mertz:
For: 764,030,997
Against: 45,461,072
Abstain: 20,597,465
Broker Non-Votes: 26,795,918

Nominee Ashley Still:
For: 823,234,961
Against: 6,313,403
Abstain: 541,170
Broker Non-Votes: 26,795,918

Nominee Tony Xu:
For: 762,280,128
Against: 47,247,651
Abstain: 20,561,755
Broker Non-Votes: 26,795,918

Based on the votes set forth above, each director nominee was duly elected to serve until the 2027 annual meeting of stockholders and until their successor is duly elected and qualified.
subsections.Proposal 2: Ratification of Appointment:
The voting results for the ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP were as follows:

For: 856,256,789
Against: 123,333
Abstain: 505,330

Based on the votes set forth above, the stockholders ratified the appointment of KPMG LLP as the Company’s independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024.
subsections.Proposal 3: Advisory Vote on Compensatio:
The voting results for the advisory vote on the compensation of the Company's named executive officers were as follows:

For: 797,445,975
Against: 31,847,550
Abstain: 796,009
Broker Non-Votes: 26,795,918

Based on the votes set forth above, the stockholders approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Company’s named executive officers.
